Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: first step is to identify which activities are repeated in a single case. Looking at the logs provided: For C001: Verify Documents occurs twice. Call Customer once. For C002: Call Customer occurs twice. Verify Documents once. For C003: Verify Documents twice. Call Customer once.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with C001: 1. First Verify Documents is when the agent checks identity documents initially. 2. The second occurrence is after the customer submitted additional docs, so the agent rechecks. So the first might be initial verification, the second a re-verification after additional info.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then C002: Call Customer first is to clarify account discrepancy, then again to confirm adjustments. So first is an outbound call for clarification, second is a follow-up for confirmation.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: C003: First Verify Documents is physical check at the branch. Second is after account adjustment, so re-verification post-adjustment. The Call Customer here is because the customer stepped out, so its a callback to return.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So for Verify Documents, the first instance is initial check, the second is re-verification either after additional info or after account adjustments. Similarly, Call Customer has different purposes: requesting missing info, clarifying discrepancies, confirming adjustments, or asking the customer to return.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For Verify Documents: If its the first occurrence in the case and context is initial check, rename to Initial Document Verification. If its after a submission or adjustment, rename to Re-Verification of Documents Post-Update or similar. For Call Customer: Depending on context: Request Missing Documents, Clarify Account Discrepancy, Confirm Account Adjustments, Request Customer Return.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The task says: activities that appear multiple times within the same case. So only rename those that are repeated in the same case. For example, in C002, Verify Documents occurs once, so no rename. In C001 and C003, Verify Documents occurs twice, so rename both instances.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For C001: Verify Documents first: Initial Document Verification. Second: Document Re-Verification After Submission. Call Customer: Call to Request Missing Documents. For C002: Call Customer first: Outbound Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy. Second: Follow-Up Call to Confirm Adjustments. For C003: Verify Documents first: Physical Identity Document Verification. Second: Re-Verification of Documents Post-Account Adjustment. Call Customer: Callback to Request Customer Return.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The key is to focus on intra-case duplicates. Therefore, only rename the activities that are repeated within the same case. Single occurrences like Call Customer in C001 and C003, Verify Documents in C002 remain as is.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Revised Event Log: C001: Initiate Request, Initial Document Verification, Call Customer, Submit Additional, Re-Verification After Submission, Approve Request. C002: Initiate Request, Verify Documents, Clarify Account Discrepancy Call, Adjust Account, Confirm Adjustments Follow-Up Call, Approve Request. C003: Initiate Request, Initial Physical Document Verification, Call Customer, Adjust Account, Post-Adjustment Document Re-Verification, Approve Request. Justification: Verify Documents in C001 and C003 renamed to distinguish initial checks from re-verifications. Call Customer in C002 split into distinct activities reflecting purposes.
